Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileManager

  • public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    File management tools for use in reading and writing to files.
    Since:
    Feb. 12, 2020
    Author:
    P. Link

      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Supplier> suppliers
      Holds the list of suppliers, specifically for looking up the suppliers in readItems().

    • Method Detail

      • readItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> readItems()
        Reads in all the items in an items.txt file. Components of each line in the file: 0id; 1name; 2quantity; 3price; 4supplierID. Suppliers must already be generated for this method to function (design error, but present in the reference implementation video).
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Items, read from the file

      • findSupplier

        public Supplier findSupplier(int supplierID)
        Finds a Supplier object reference from a Supplier ID. Requires that readSuppliers() has already been run, populating the private global variable 'suppliers'.
        Parameters:
        supplierID - The ID of the supplier to lookup
        Returns:
        Reference to the supplier object, or null if it is not found.

      • readSuppliers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Supplier> readSuppliers()
        Reads in all the suppliers in a suppliers.txt file. Components of each line: 0id, 1name, 2address, 3contact. This method was adapted from the readItems() method.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Suppliers, read from the file
        Since:
        Feb 16, 2020
